intro: Beadlea subalpestris, commonly known as the alpine beadlea, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescence and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky soils at high elevations, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its small white flowers bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Beadlea subalpestris is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in alpine ecosystems.
